text: (No need to wrap it in Julia code or anything like that, I'm only curious about the time it takes to write the regex to capture the info)

elements.text: (No need to wrap it in Julia code or anything like that, I'm only curious about the time it takes to write the regex to capture the info)

text: I'd also count myself as experienced with regex, so I'm not your target group. But I really like the example! It has clear delimiters and you can work your way from matching the first line to also match the optional parts in the subsequent lines. So I think in terms of progression it works very well. Also in terms of difficulty level, as there is no serious variation or nesting (like the title being `»Title«` or `"Title"` or `'Title with "quotes"'`, which would make it a lot harder). Really nice exercise imho :+1:
